topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54557e29636872556cc90100#post_54557e29636872556cc90100
I think you just summarized 99% of economics in one sentence.

I do have to give credit to gun manufacturers though; rather than running around like chickens with their heads cut off in panic, they are instead behaving rationally and cutting production realizing it's going to be at least a decade until sales are stable again.  Most other industries when things get bad they freak out and ramp up production even though that makes things even worse.  If they were acting like other industries then right about now they would have been instead ramping up production to insanity levels and causing their own collapse.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54557cb763687203efaa0000#post_54557cb763687203efaa0000
Do you suspect that this was part of the Liberals' plan to make the Gun manufacturers crash like this? To scare people into buying guns and "lure" manufacturers into over-production. It's likely they know how consumers and manufacturers react to these news of these kinds of bills being announced to the public. They've seen the effect many times in the past.

Is it true that Texas has the largest amount of gun owners in the US?

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545580d06368723ac92d0100#post_545580d06368723ac92d0100
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54557cb763687203efaa0000#post_54557cb763687203efaa0000
Do you suspect that this was part of the Liberals' plan to make the Gun manufacturers crash like this? To scare people into buying guns and "lure" manufacturers into over-production. It's likely they know how consumers and manufacturers react to these news of these kinds of bills being announced to the public. They've seen the effect many times in the past.

Is it true that Texas has the largest amount of gun owners in the US?[/bq]
Christ; no, no no.

It was just a inevitability, because think about it for a second.  For the past couple decades there's been paranoia about guns on both sides; that school shooting didn't cause the paranoia, but rather it was the trigger for a massive paranoia freakout that caused the house of cards to come down.  It wasn't liberals or conservatives that caused all this, rather all they really did was ramp up all in society until something had to snap.  The school shooting was the thing that made society snap.

To use a analogy it's like the ebola scare going on; I really wish politicians would stop trying to scare people about it cause eventually if they keep driving up the paranoia and keep driving up the paranoia eventually society's just going to snap and have a panic attack.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5455851863687250ed0e0100#post_5455851863687250ed0e0100
Don't fuck with male lions.

"Lion vs Tiger":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tt_ROaAQS-8
Supposedly, both cats are just as strong as each other. But the lion's protective mane was what gave it the edge against the tiger. The tiger was eventually worn out of exhaustion.

In Greek mythology, Leo had skin that were impervious to all weapons.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54558b0063687273f6510000#post_54558b0063687273f6510000
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545588ff6368727e855d0000#post_545588ff6368727e855d0000
But it's disgusting that people would use these appalling events as some sort of catalyst to further validate their political agendas.[/bq]
I actually don't mind, because the more people cry wolf the more and more people will not believe them.

Really getting into politics here, but it's the difference between 9/11 and the boston bombing.  After 9/11 the usa went to two wars; drove the paranoia home for over a decade to the point you can't even carry water on a plane, constantly driving this idea of "you're going to die cause of terrorism" and such, *BUT* after the boston bombing everyone just went, "yeah; terrorism, just another part of life".

It's kind of hilarious in a way cause for a decade one of the main driving forces against internet security was this idea of "if you promote internet security you're helping terrorists" and with wikileaks no one is buying that anymore.  The reason why it's so hilarious is that no one is buying that crap anymore to such a extent that the fbi is trying to say that promoting internet security is protecting pedophiles. . . . I'm not joking either.  If you're wondering what I mean by this is 2001 to 2013, "Oh my god if your internet is secure then terrorists might be able to attack america!"; 2014, "no matter what there will be terrorist attacks so is the scare really justified?", fbi "crap, better come up with a new societal scare then. . . I know; 'everyone if you promote internet security pedophiles will take over society'"; everyone else, "you're seriously that desperate? seriously?"

Tl:dr; the more people drive home paranoia the less and less effective it is.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
